Photoshop (1) <--> In this tutorial, you will learn how to use the Repousse tool to create a 3D grungy text effect. We will be using Adobe Photoshop CS5 — unfortunately, the Repousse tool is not available in older versions of Photoshop. So if you have CS3 or 4, let this inspire you to upgrade. We will be using the 2 textures below to give our 3D text some character. Material 1: This texture will be used for the text. Material 2: This will be used as the background. First, use the Type tool (T) to type a word — I’m using “BOOM!” With the text layer selected, go to 3D > Repousse > Text Layer.” You can change the text perspective to whatever you like. With the text layer still selected, go to Window > 3D Then, in the 3D (materials) tab, choose Load Texture and pick Material 1. Insert Material 1 into both Front Inflation Material and Extrusion Material. Now that you’ve placed your texture on the letters, we want to smooth the edges. In the 3D (Scene) tab, scroll up and select Scene, and in the Quality dropdown menu select Ray Traced Draft. Sit back, relax and wait while the rendering process is complete.
Photoshop (2) <--> How to Make Letter Press effect in Photoshop When you open Photoshop CS version, it\'s usually you will noticed the logo text just like pressed inside. That\'s is Letter Press. Now let\'s begin First, create a text by press T on Photoshop then start writing whatever you want to. I\'am using Justice League font with size 34. Double click text layer until showing up Layer Style. Then click Inner Shadow. Change the opacity to suit your needs. All right, the Letter Press text is done, now if you want to beautify your text, you can add some Shadow or Bevel and Emboss.
Photoshop (3)<--> How to color grading photo in Photoshop If your photo is bored look like, you can just add some color grading on it, But i think you can do lot more than that. Here the Before and After. First, open Photoshop then click File --> Open and select the image that you want. After that unlock the image in layer tab (bottom right, labelled Lock Sign), click the lock sign 1 time. Go to Camera raw filter, click Filter --> Camera Raw Filter After the box is showed up, you can play with the Tempreture or Tint or something, but i recommend if you want to change your picture to make it better, take an example from the picture, if the picture color is Orange then slide the temperature to right, or if your photo default temperature is blue, you can slide the temperature to the left. Like this picture: After you finish, just click Ok then the picture is ready to export. Thanks for the attention and have fun :).
